content:
# Serenity/JS

[Serenity/JS](https://serenity-js.org) is a Node.js library designed to make acceptance and regression testing
of modern full-stack applications faster, more collaborative and easier to scale.

## Serenity/JS Mocha

The `@serenity-js/mocha` module contains a reporter that can be registered with the [Mocha test runner](https://mochajs.org/) to enable integration between Mocha and Serenity/JS.

### Usage

Run Mocha with the `@serenity-js/mocha` reporter: 

```
mocha --reporter=@serenity-js/mocha
```

or add `@serenity-js/mocha` reporter in Mocha [configuration file](https://mochajs.org/#configuring-mocha-nodejs):

```yaml
# .mocharc.yml
reporter: '@serenity-js/mocha'

# ...other config
```

spec/OutcomeRecorder.spec.ts
it1
description: returns no outcome if no outcome was recorded

name: it2
description: returns an outcome recorded for a given test

name: it3
description: allows for a recorded outcome to be erased

name: spec/mappers/MochaOutcomeMapper.spec.ts
it9
description: recognises tests that failed with a Serenity/JS AssertionError

name: it10
description: recognises tests that failed with a generic AssertionError

name: it11
description: recognises tests that failed with an Error

name: spec/mappers/MochaTestMapper.spec.ts
it13
description: treats the outer-most describe as the name of the feature

name: it14
description: maps a Mocha test to Serenity/JS ScenarioDetails
